unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post on Mental Health Apps, designed as per your instructions:
normalised: **Mental Health Apps: Yay or Nay? Let's Discuss!**

unnormalised: **Mental Health Apps: Yay or Nay? Let's Discuss!**
normalised: Hey everyone! Been thinking a lot lately about mental health, especially with the hustle of modern life in places like Mumbai. It's intense, right? I've seen so many ads for mental health apps popping up – Calm, Headspace, even desi ones like Wysa. Has anyone actually tried them?

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been thinking a lot lately about mental health, especially with the hustle of modern life in places like Mumbai. It's intense, right? I've seen so many ads for mental health apps popping up – Calm, Headspace, even desi ones like Wysa. Has anyone actually tried them?
normalised: I'm curious if they're genuinely helpful or just another way for companies to make rupees out of people's anxieties. My friend, Priya Sharma from I I T Delhi, swears by one for mindfulness. She says it helps her manage stress during exam season. But I also read an article about some apps sharing user data… scary!

unnormalised: I'm curious if they're genuinely helpful or just another way for companies to make Rs. out of people's anxieties. My friend, Priya Sharma from IIT Delhi, swears by one for mindfulness. She says it helps her manage stress during exam season. But I also read an article about some apps sharing user data… scary!
normalised: Are these apps a genuine resource for managing stress, anxiety, or even just improving sleep quality? Or are we better off sticking to traditional methods like yoga at the local ashram, talking to a trusted friend (maybe over chai!), or seeking professional help from a qualified Doctor?

unnormalised: Are these apps a genuine resource for managing stress, anxiety, or even just improving sleep quality? Or are we better off sticking to traditional methods like yoga at the local ashram, talking to a trusted friend (maybe over chai!), or seeking professional help from a qualified Dr.?
normalised: I'm also wondering about accessibility. How many folks in rural areas like, say, Rajasthan (where my grandparents live in a small house of about eight hundred square feet) have the internet bandwidth and devices to even use these apps?

unnormalised: I'm also wondering about accessibility. How many folks in rural areas like, say, Rajasthan (where my grandparents live in a small house of about 800 sq ft) have the internet bandwidth and devices to even use these apps?
normalised: What are your experiences? Good, bad, or indifferent? Let's hear it! Any recommendations? Any apps to avoid like the plague? Share your thoughts! Dhanyavad!

unnormalised: What are your experiences? Good, bad, or indifferent? Let's hear it! Any recommendations? Any apps to avoid like the plague? Share your thoughts! Dhanyavad!
